body:
> *(Image: Ethiopian Premier League Share Company)*

St. George's title challenge gains momentum after a comfortable 2-0 win in BetKing Ethiopian Premier League action over Bahir Dar City on Thursday.

 

The Horsemen got off to a great start with a goal from Abel Yalew's strike inside the first minutes, 39 secs to be exact. Abel has now scored three goals in back-to-back games as he eyes a return to the national team. Kenean Markneh widened the lead in the twentieth as he capitalized on Bahir Dar's goalkeeper Abubeker Nuri's mistake to score an open goal.

 

The Blue Waves are still without head coach Abraham Mebrahtu, who is away temporary due to his being appointed a member of the CAF technical committee that analyzes player and team performances at the African Cup of Nations in Cameroon.

 

Without their head coach, Bahir Dar have now suffered back to back defeats which have them back in eight place, some nine points off of league leaders St. George. The Horsemen extend their unbeaten streak to eleven games.

 

Bahir Dar has but a single victory in its past five games and will look to bounce back against Hawassa City next Thursday.
title: Horsemen extend undefeated streak to eleven games
author: Ebawak Tesfaye @negussu_
